meanings.definition: A person who believes in or supports the principles of an institution.
meanings.sent1: The institutionalist was dedicated to upholding the values of the school.
meanings.sent2: She was known as an institutionalist for her unwavering loyalty to the company.
meanings.sent3: The institutionalist found humor in following all the rules to the letter.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as an institutionalist made him the pillar of the community.
meanings.sent5: The institutionalist's commitment to tradition was unmatched.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of institutions.
meanings.sent1: The institutionalist policies aimed to strengthen the organization.
meanings.sent2: The building's institutionalist design reflected its purpose as a government office.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the institutionalist decor in such a modern setting.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to problem-solving was as structured as an institutionalist blueprint.
meanings.sent5: The institutionalist nature of the organization provided stability and order.
